intro: Hymenoxys helenioides, commonly known as the Helen's daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its showy yellow center with white or pale yellow ray flowers makes it a distinctive and attractive wildflower. Hymenoxys helenioides is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
